column4: Can someone tell me how do I install latest Nvidia Drivers on my linux thru command promt at start-up?
I'd like to know that myself
I'm new to linux. So it's hard for me to know all the commands. :(
what error does your friend encounter.
I've been using Linux a little bit over a year, and I still don't know all the commands
he gets the blue screen of "your xserver has crashed"  that is shortly after I installed VMWare for him
just blank prompt, or does it actually have something meaningful like "log in"
a black screen with login command prompt. I'm able to login thru that.
Oh.. you probably changed your xorg.conf file recently
I have never used ubuntu before. This is what I get ever since I install it on my computer two days ago.
oh.  even from the first time you installed it?
after you log in, try the command "startx"
yes that is correct.
so either your driver isn't working, or you have installed the server edition
I can assure you that it's not the server edition. :)
the driver you can get from nVidias website.. which you can access through a command line browser like lynx
I would love to get the correct drivers installed but don't know where to start.
sudo apt-get install links and then links nvidia.com or something... and find the one for your model
how do I use that command prompt to install them after putting them on CD.
you dont need to put them on a CD
you can download them straight from the website and install
you may also get some help on the Ubuntu Forums, if you post the file /etc/X11/xorg.conf
